snippet: Johan Santana, who threw the Mets’ first no-hitter June 1, on Friday became the only pitcher in franchise history to give up six runs or more in five consecutive starts.
abstract: Washington Nationals defeat the New York Mets, 6-4.
lead_paragraph: Johan Santana, who threw the Mets’ first no-hitter June 1, on Friday became the only pitcher in franchise history to give up six runs or more in five consecutive starts.

headline.seo: Johan Santana Hit Hard in Mets’ 6-4 Loss to Nationals
headline.main: With Another Mets First, Santana Raises Concerns Instead of Spirits
headline.print_headline: With Another Mets First, Santana Raises Concerns Instead of Spirits
